title: First picture of Liverpool's proposed new £50million state-of-the-art training complex
text:
First picture of Liverpool's proposed new £50million state-of-the-art training complex The Reds confirmed on Wednesday morning there intention to leave their Melwood home in favour of transforming the current Kirkby academy set-up Share Comments By Ian Doyle 10:58, 22 FEB 2017 Sport Liverpool are moving from Melwood (Photo: KSS) football This is the first image of Liverpool 's proposed new £50million state-of-the-art training complex.
The Reds confirmed on Wednesday morning there intention to leave their Melwood home in favour of transforming the current Kirkby academy set-up.
The plan is to create a brand new facility to house both the first-team and youth teams in the same place.
Liverpool intend to sell their current home which would lead to around 160 family homes being built, report the Liverpool Echo.
The club intend to purchase 14 acres of land at Simonswood Playing Fields at the rear of the Academy in order to expand the size of the current site in Kirkby to around 60 acres.
Read More Liverpool confirm move from Melwood to new £50million training complex on site of youth academy It will see the Reds leave Melwood training ground where they have been based since the 1950s (Photo: Getty) The Reds are relocating (Photo: Liverpool Echo) And are set for new facilities near the site of their academy (Photo: Liverpool Echo) A public consultation for Kirkby residents and businesses will be held on March 8 at Northwood Community Centre from 2pm to 8pm.
Residents in Kirkby can visit a special website for more information, while residents in West Derby can visit another website for news of the proposed planning application for Melwood.
